}} 'Calvin Pearly "Ginger, Red, Torchy" Gardner' (October 30, 1924 - October 10,
2001) was a professional ice hockey player in the NHL. In 1943, after playing
professional hockey for three years and winning the Memorial Cup, he joined the
Canadian military and took part in World War II. At the conclusion of the war,
he once again began playing professional hockey. He died in 2001. His two sons
Paul and Dave were also professional ice hockey players.
categories: Canadian military personnel of World War II
